diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Constrictive Pericarditis From a Severely Calcified Pericardium
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by ECG findings of normal sinus rhythm with abnormal patterns, chest X-ray revealing severe calcification of the pericardium, and echocardiographic and hemodynamic data showing elevated and equalized diastolic pressures consistent with constrictive pericarditis.
